# Research Example Contribution

Thank you for contributing to the AWS Academic Research Gallery! Please fill out the information below to help us review your submission.

## Type of Contribution
<!-- Check the box that applies: [x] -->

- [ ] **New Research Project** - Adding a new example
- [ ] **Edit Existing Entry** - Correcting or updating information
- [ ] **Removal Request** - Suggesting removal of an entry

---

## For New Research Projects

**Institution:**
<!-- University, research lab, or organization name -->

**Country:**
<!-- Country where the research is conducted -->

**Project Title:**
<!-- Brief, descriptive title of the research project -->

**Project Description:**
<!-- 1-2 sentences describing the research and its impact -->

**AWS Services Used:**
<!-- List the primary AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, Bedrock, SageMaker) -->

**Year:**
<!-- When the project was conducted (e.g., 2024, 2023-2024, 2023-ongoing) -->

**Key Achievement (optional):**
<!-- Notable results, metrics, or outcomes -->

**Source URL:**
<!-- Link to blog post, case study, research paper, or university announcement -->

**Domain(s):**
<!-- Select all that apply: AI/ML, Medical, Education, Genomics, Climate, Chemistry, Neuroscience, Robotics, Physics, Conservation, Cultural Heritage, Economics -->

**Program Affiliation (if applicable):**
<!-- e.g., Build on Trainium, Science Hub, GenAI Innovation Center, Open Data, Partner -->

## Verification Checklist
<!-- Check all that apply -->

- [ ] I have verified the information is accurate and from a reliable source
- [ ] The source URL is publicly accessible and credible
- [ ] This is actual research work (not just a grant announcement or award recipient without demonstrated work)
- [ ] The project has a substantive connection to AWS services
- [ ] I have checked that this entry doesn't duplicate an existing one
